subject: Re: [junit] Do JUnit internals suck?!?
msgSnippet: ... [...] Doesn t the public static TestSuite suite() method solve this problem?  Certainly it has about the semantics you want -- give me the set of tests
messageBody:
Quoth Michael Silverstein:
> Mr. Loritsch exactly describes the problem I ran into yesterday while
> extending the Test Mentor tool to have its test components (that live in a
> different hierarchy) appear like JUnit tests. My first inclination was to
> simply have Test Mentor test components implement the junit.framework.Test
> interface and then implement countTestCases() and run(TestResult). The
> problem I ran in to is that we don't compose tests by way of methods
> beginning with 'testxxx', as JUnit does. What would have made the job a lot
> easier would have been some method in the Test interface that is passed a
> test collector, such as collectTests(TestCollector), for example.
[...]

Doesn't the
public static TestSuite suite()
method solve this problem? Certainly it has about the semantics
you want -- "give me the set of tests you consist of".
